WorkItem.Description:
Description: WOW Taiwan recently merged her service to Battle.Net, including Armory, and seems to be workable.
Suggestion: Re-enable the support for Taiwanese realms.
 
Hint: 
1. TW battle.net page prefix:
http://tw.battle.net/wow/zh/
 
2. TW battle.net Armory character url format: 
http://tw.battle.net/wow/zh/character/{Encoded Realm Name in Trad. Chinese, like 奧妮克希亞 (Onyxia in English) as %e5%a5%a7%e5%a6%ae%e5%85%8b%e5%b8%8c%e4%ba%9e}/{Encoded Character Nane}/simple
 
3. Currently, only Chinese Traditional pages are available in TW Battle.net.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request] Re-enable Load Character Support from Battle.Net support for Taiwanese realms

Comments.Message: Can it be done if the mapping table between the raw Chinese parsing string and its correspoding English parsing string can be provided?

We can't, the page only parses in the Zh language-set and ours is designed to read English. Try using the Addon instead.



** Closed by Jothay 17/5/2011 10:08
Can it be done if the mapping table between the raw Chinese parsing string and its correspoding English parsing string can be provided?
